intro: Andrachne gruvelii, commonly known as the Gruvel's sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to survive in nutrient-poor conditions. Andrachne gruvelii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
